user: What is the notice period and can I buy it out?
assistant:
The notice period varies depending on the employee's role, salary grade, and who is terminating the employment:

**Notice period given by an employee to terminate employment:**
*   **During probationary period:** 1 week [1] or seven (7) calendar days [4, 5]
*   **Up to Salary Grade 8:** 1 month [1]
*   **Grade 9 to Grade 11:** 2 months [1]
*   **Grade 12 to Grade 14:** 3 months [1]
*   **Recognised skills shortage posts:** minimum two months [1]
*   **Exempt staff and professional level staff:** at least four weeks (written notice) [6]
*   **Paraprofessional positions:** at least 10 working days (written notice) [6]

**Minimum notice period when employment is terminated by the council:**
*   **Up to 4 years continuous service:** 1 month [1]
*   **5 years continuous service:** 5 weeks [1]
*   **6 years continuous service:** 6 weeks [1]
*   **7 years continuous service:** 7 weeks [1]
*   **8 years continuous service:** 8 weeks [1]
*   **9 years continuous service:** 9 weeks [1]
*   **10 years continuous service:** 10 weeks [1]
*   **11 years continuous service:** 11 weeks [1]
*   **12 years continuous service:** 12 weeks [1]
*   **Employees in receipt of a market supplement:** minimum two months’ notice [1]
*   **Dismissal as a result of gross misconduct:** normally without notice or payment in lieu of notice [1]

**Can you buy out the notice period?**
*   A probationary employee may resign with a notice period of seven (7) calendar days or payment in lieu thereof. [4, 5]
*   The handbook does not explicitly state that other employees can buy out their notice period. The Association (employer) may, at its sole discretion, provide an additional payment or notice period. [1]

Sources:
[1] YEO - HR Employee Handbook Mar 2021.pdf (page 48, chunk 1)
[4] EMPLOYEE-HANDBOOK-PART-1 (1).pdf (page 17, chunk 1)
[5] EMPLOYEE-HANDBOOK-PART-1.pdf (page 17, chunk 1)
[6] Employee-Handbook-2023_ONLINE-version.pdf (page 17, chunk 1)

The probation period policy is as follows:

*   The first three (3) months of employment are probationary. [1]
*   The overall duration of a probation period should not exceed nine (9) months. [1]
*   The probation period may be extended for a specified period if the Company determines that the designated period does not allow sufficient time to thoroughly evaluate the employee's performance. [1]
*   Probation may be extended for an additional six months. [1]
*   Any significant absence during the probationary period will automatically extend the period by the length of the absence. [1, 5]
*   During the probation period, the employee and the immediate supervisor shall meet to review progress to date. [1]
*   A probationary period may also apply to existing employees who are successful in obtaining new positions within the Association through formalized job postings. [1]
*   Internally hired employees or employees transferred/appointed into a new job function or role shall be subjected to a minimum of three (3) months’ probation on the new role. [1]
*   During the three (3) month probationary period, employment may be terminated by either party for any reason whatsoever with or without cause, and without notice or payment in lieu of notice, except as may be minimally prescribed by the ESA. [1]
*   There is no obligation on the part of the Association to retain a probationary employee until the end of the three (3)-month probationary period, and the Association may decide to terminate the employment relationship without cause and/or without advance notice, except as prescribed by law. [1]
*   During the probation period, new employees are only eligible for those benefits that are required by law. [1]
*   Upon satisfactory completion of the probation period by a formal evaluation, employees receive a confirmation letter and assume the "permanent" employment classification. [1]
*   Management reserves the right to determine the appointment of employees with unsatisfactory probationary performance. [1]

Sources:
[1] YEO - HR Employee Handbook Mar 2021.pdf (page 27, chunk 0)
[5] YEO - HR Employee Handbook Mar 2021.pdf (page 26, chunk 1)

user: How many sick leaves are allowed?
assistant:
The number of sick leaves allowed varies based on employee type and work schedule:

*   **General Full-Time Employees:**
    *   All eligible employees are credited with twenty-four (24) hours of sick leave at the beginning of each work year. [1]
    *   Full-time employees accrue additional sick leave per month worked, totaling eighty (80) hours for ten (10) month employees and ninety-six (96) hours for twelve (12) month employees, for each full work year. [1]
    *   Accrued sick leave can be carried forward each year. [1]

*   **Sick Days/Year Accrual Table:**
    *   For 9 months worked: 6 sick days/year (accrued .67 per month for 9 months). [1]
    *   For 200 days/year worked: 6 sick days/year (accrued .5 per month for 12 months). [1]
    *   For 240 days/year worked: 8 sick days/year (accrued .67 per month for 12 months). [1]
    *   For 260 days/year worked: 9 sick days/year (accrued .75 per month for 12 months). [1]

*   **Police Department:**
    *   Full-time employees earn eight (8) hours, ten (10) hours, or twelve (12) hours sick leave depending on the shift assigned. [1]

*   **Fire Department:**
    *   Shift personnel should refer to Article 16, Leaves of Absence, Sick Leave of the labor agreement between City of Gautier and Local 3290. [1]

*   **School Employees:**
    *   Paid sick leave is available to all School employees who work at least thirty (30) days within the span of a single calendar year from the commencement of employment. [1]

Sources:
[1] Revised Employee Handbook 2017_202303081707088285.pdf (page 19, chunk 1)
